content: I have a (rendered) node reference to a webform on an event content type. (Different events reference the same webform.) What I'm trying to achieve now: The option to disable a node reference automatically at a date which can be specified by editors. Has somebody ever done something similar?
Nope, sounds like a custom module or rule is needed
Hi Olaf, did you try to create a reference list in Views (e.g. show only the dates which are in the future minus 1 day)? You then can reference it in the field. Does this answer your question...?

sounds like a custom module or rule is needed

Speaking of "rule", I saw there is a "Rules Scheduler" submodule, I might give it a try. @Graham Oliver Do you know something about the current status of Rules Scheduler? (Haven't used Rules in Backdrop at all so far.)

did you try to create a reference list in Views (...)?

No, didn't try. I think that's not what I need but I should verify my assumption.
Thanks for your feedback, @Herb and @mazze.ch !
I was thinking that @mazze.ch idea made sense to me but perhaps I don't fully understand your case

Herb said:

I was thinking that @mazze.ch idea made sense to me but perhaps I don't fully understand your case

Yes, I should explain it better, also because I'm not sure if I understand the suggestion.

So, here's a (simplified) description:

  • I have an Event content type with Title, Body text, Location, the Event date, and a Registration deadline date. There are several events on the website.
  • On the Event content type there is another field: a node reference autocomplete to webforms. If I select the webform in question (always the same, see below), it will be displayed / embedded on the Event page.
  • The webform is built to allow registering for different Events. The form is always the same, and it doesn't hold a date. It contains only a Name field, contact details, and a checkbox "I want to attend". (There is also a token-based read-only field which holds the Event title so that I can filter the submissions by event.)

Now, when I reference the webform as an editor, it will be embedded on the Event page. Then, at the Registration deadline date, I have to disable the form manually. My goal is to build something which disables the form automatically at the deadline date.
Maybe a Views block that takes the current page nid to get the event info, then links to webform via a relationship (on the reference field), and filters on event dates in the future?

Laryn said:

Maybe a Views block that takes the current page nid to get the event info, then links to webform via a relationship (on the reference field), and filters on event dates in the future?

Re https://backdrop.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/218635-Backdrop/topic/Reference.20scheduling/near/193213267: A friend helped me with this use-case writing a custom module. On my event node, it sets the node reference to a webform back to an empty value when the deadline date for Event registration is arrived (or, at the next cron run).
In case someone needs a similar functionality, I'll be happy to share the code. (Maybe also of interest for your event registration use-case, @mazze.ch ?)
